ns2:testcase.ns3:title: FS-LON-048/PSA-LON-001-082/System must adjust interest accrued for excess dollar amount not accounted for by reversal of fees/MLA/Positive
ns2:testcase.ns3:description:
When the account-level MAPR is greater than the institutional-level MAPR, and, after reversal of all normal fees, there is still an excess amount to be dealt with, the system must adjust the interest accrual for the remaining dollar amount.
For example, if there were 100 dollars to be adjusted, and there were fees of 20, 30, 40, and 35 plus 35 in accrued interest, then the system would reverse the fees, starting with the last (for 40), and moving back to the 30 and then the 20. After reversal of the last fee, there would still be 10 in excess to account for. The system must then use a normal interest adjustment transaction to adjust the interest by 10, thereby reducing the account-level MAPR to = or below the institution-level MAPR.
